# Tear down the environment in case the previous run failed. docker-compose -f docker-compose.int.yml -p <%= projectName %>_int stop || true docker-compose -f docker-compose.int.yml -p <%= projectName %>_int rm -f || true
#!/bin/bash cancel() { docker-compose -f docker-compose.int.yml -p kobol_int stop || true docker-compose -f docker-compose.int.yml -p kobol_int rm -f || true exit 34 }
# Abort build step on errors. trap 'cancel' ERR
# Set up and install site bash bin/start.sh int
# Run cron for maximized database freshness. docker-compose -f build.int.yml -p <%= projectName %>_int run drush cron
# Export database. This process preserves the latest 5 databases. DATE=$(date +%Y-%m-%d_%H:%M:%S) docker-compose -f build.int.yml -p <%= projectName %>_int run cli bash bin/db-export.sh nightlies/$DATE.sql
# Perform a scan for module updates. docker-compose -f build.int.yml -p <%= projectName %>_int run cli bash bin/update-scanner.sh
# Tear-down docker-compose -f docker-compose.int.yml -p <%= projectName %>_int stop docker-compose -f docker-compose.int.yml -p <%= projectName %>_int rm -f
